quote: Captain's log, stardate 41249.3.   We have orbited the two major   planets of the Beta Renner system   taking aboard delegates from   those two worlds. Since achieving   space flight, their major life   forms, the Anticans and the   Selay...
scene: 1    EXT. SPACE - USS ENTERPRISE IN ORBIT (OPTICAL)

quote: ... have become deadly enemies.   But both have also applied for   admission into our Federation.   We are to deliver these   delegates to this sector's neutral   Conference Planet called   "Parliament" in the hope their   dispute can be resolved.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I am Captain Picard. We hope   to make this journey pleasant   and comfortable. Arranging   that will be my first officer,   Commander Riker.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Welcome aboard. If you'll follow   me...       ... I'll show you the   accommodations we've...
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: We can already smell the Anticans.   They were taken aboard first?
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Only because their world was the   first on our heading to   Parliament.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Will our quarters be near the   Anticans?
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: About one hundred meters apart.   Is that all right?
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: No. Unsatisfactory.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I believe we can accommodate their   wishes, Captain.       We'll rearrange suite assignments.   If you'll follow me?
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: And we must be upwind from the   Anticans.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Of course, sir...
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Neither seem very promising   Federation candidates.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Even Parliament's peacemakers may   find this case difficult.
scene: 2    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM 4 - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Do you understand the basis of   all that nonsense between them?
No sir. I didn't understand that   kind of hostility even when I   studied Earth history.
Oh? Well, yes, but these life   forms feel such passionate hatred   over differences in customs, God   concepts, and even strangely enough,   economic systems...
Sir, my sensors are picking up   an unusual energy object ahead.
On screen.
Confirmed, sir. My sensors read   nothing solid but considerable   energy in...       ... in changing patterns.
Traveling at warp speed, too.   Intriguing.       I can find no match with anything   in our records, sir.
Change course for a close sensor   pass... we'll then increase warp   speed to reach Parliament on   schedule.
Aye, sir.
Why the interest in this, Worf?   It is just routine maintenance   on the sensor assemblies.
scene: 10   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON GEORDI AND WORF

quote: Simple, Geordi. Our captain   wants his junior officers to   learn, learn, learn...
scene: 10   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON GEORDI AND WORF

quote: Not just the junior ones.       Okay, hold this relay off-line   while...
scene: 10   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON GEORDI AND WORF

quote: Security to Sensor Maintenance.
scene: 10   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON GEORDI AND WORF

quote: La Forge here.
scene: 10   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON GEORDI AND WORF

quote: We're making a close sensor pass   on an unusual object, Geordi.   Any problems?
None, Lieutenant. All equipment   on line and functioning.
Sensors ready, sir.
Life form reading?
No life form reading, sir.
Begin the pass.
Sir, it is changing shape... !
scene: 13   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Any readings indicating matter   there?
Negative, Captain. Energy only.
La Forge to Sickbay. Medical   emergency in Sensor Maintenance   Room!
scene: 17   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: Repeat -- medical emergency!
scene: 17   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: What happened?
scene: 19   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: Don't know. It seemed like he   was hit by...       ... some sensor feedback, maybe.
scene: 19   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: Lieutenant Worf?       Lieutenant, can you hear what I'm   saying?
scene: 19   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: Let's get him up.
scene: 19   INT. SENSOR MAINTENANCE ROOM - ON WORF AND GEORDI

quote: He was just monitoring the sensor   console when he jerked as though   something hit him. What my   sensors showed...       ... It was kind of a... glow... just   for a second. I can't explain it.
scene: 21   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON GEORDI AND PICARD

quote: Could your VISOR device have   malfunctioned?
scene: 21   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON GEORDI AND PICARD

quote: Doubt it, sir. It seemed what   I was seeing was something real.
scene: 21   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON GEORDI AND PICARD

quote: I'm going to give you something   to help you rest. Just relax.
scene: 22   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY, TROI, WORF

quote: Fortunately, he's stronger than   an orbital tug. There's nothing   physically wrong with him. What   have you sensed?
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: Nothing... which bothers me. He   has never shielded his feelings   from me. I can't understand why   he is suddenly doing it now.
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: Are you able to perceive anything   at all, Counselor? It may be   important.
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: Perhaps... very faintly.   Almost... like a frightened   child.
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: Worf "frightened?"
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: It doesn't make much sense but...       Yes, it's fear. Definitely there.
scene: 23   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND TROI

quote: Sorry to call you, sir, not   strictly security, it's about   the dietary requirements of the   Antican delegates.
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: I thought that had been taken care   of in advance, Tasha.
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: So did we, sir. Their live   animals were beamed aboard -- We   were going to preserve the meat   for them, but ....       ... they say we must bring it to   them alive.
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: Then do so!       Lieutenant Yar was... confused.   We no longer enslave animals   for food purposes.
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: But we have seen humans eat meat!
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: You've seen something as fresh   and tasty as living meat, but   inorganically materialized out   of patterns used by our   transporters.
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: How sickening! How barbaric!
scene: 25   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ON TASHA AND

quote: He's reading normal? How did you   manage that?
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Yes... normal, now.
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Are you all right?
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Yes... perfectly.
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Yes... both of us quite normal.
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Where... where am I?
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Don't you remember? You were in   the Sensor Maintenance Room ---
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: I remember monitoring the sensor   console -- and that's all. What   am I doing here?
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: That's a story the doctor will   tell you.
scene: 27   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF (OPTICAL)
location: SICKBAY - ANGLE ON BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: I called it a "cloud" for lack   of a better term at the time.   But the sensor pass shows it as   much more. Combinations very   complex, precise energy   patterns...
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: Constantly interacting on each   other?
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: Yes, sir... But whether   individually or as a whole, it   is difficult to say.
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: Obviously, you seem to feel it   should be inspected more closely.
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: A mystery is only a mystery as   long as it remains uninvestigated,   sir.
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: Ah. I love a mystery, Mister   Data, but this one has to wait   until we deliver the delegates   to their peace conference on   Parliament.
scene: 29   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON DATA AND PICARD

quote: Hi Mom. You're back early.
Yes.
Physical sciences class. We're   studying Doctor Channing's theory   on dilithium crystals.
Tell me about it.

Really? You never seemed that   interested in warp theory before.       Doctor Channing thinks it's   possible to force dilithium into   even more useful crystals. If   as shown here, matter and   antimatter could be aligned even   more efficiently...
Would that affect navigation?
This is engineering, not helm   control.
Oh yes, the helm's located on the   bridge.
Mom, is something wrong?
This... is the helm.
Unless there have been some   changes I don't know about.
Doctor Crusher?
You will wish to know Lieutenant   Worf is much improved. Ready to   report back on duty.
What was the diagnosis?
A temporary mental abberation.
When it concerns a bridge officer,   I expect a better explanation,   Doctor.
Then I must first run some   crosschecks in the   library-computer. Klingons are   so unusual in their reactions,   aren't they?
Take Science Station Two, Doctor.
Intriguing, Doctor. What does   helm control have to do with   medical crosschecks?
I... I don't know why I'm...
Is something wrong, Doctor?
Doctor, are you all right?
Yes... yes. I -- I'll do my work   from my office. That's where I   should be...
Do you want someone to accompany   you?
Counselor, what's happening to   my people?
Captain? There is a malfunction   in this station. I cannot bring   any information up on it.
Science Two does not function   either, sir.
Engineering to Captain Picard.   We have something wrong with warp   drive circuitry, sir.
Transporter Room Six to bridge.   Reporting transporter console   malfunction, sir.
Mister Data, this ship is less   than a year out of spacedock.   What are the chances of all this   occurring?
It is a virtual impossibility,   sir.
So what the hell is going on   here?
... I don't understand it,   Gentlemen. I need information.   You're telling me there is no   explanation for any of these   malfunctions?
At least, sir, all department   heads report the damage repaired.
That was not the question, Number   One. What caused the   malfunctions?
I believe it was a rampant   electronic short that jumped from   system to system, sir. The only   thing is --
Yes, Mister Singh?
That shouldn't be possible. The   affected systems don't generally   interact with each other -- and   where they do, it wasn't the   interlink that was malfunctioning.
Have you spoken with Chief   Engineer Argyle about the problem?
With all the engineering staff,   sir. They're just as puzzled.
I am not satisfied with that.       I want explanations of this by   the time we get to Parliament.
But...
By the time we get to   Parliament, Mr. Singh.
These weapons were removed   from two of your people who were   loitering out of sight in the   vicinity of the Selay delegation   quarters. Would you care to   explain, sir?
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Those are not weapons, First   Officer. They are tools we use   to dispatch the animals we consume.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Your food supply is not on the   same deck as the Selay delegation,   sir.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: And you will admit these "tools"   can kill.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Some of my people are impulsive.   and we all have reason to hate   the Selay.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: They appear to have the same   feelings about you, sir.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: That is the nature of politics.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Nonetheless, Chief Delegate, I'm   putting you on notice that all   weapons -- no matter what their   basic function -- are being   confiscated. Violence will not   be tolerated on the Enterprise.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Of course not. And if any does   occur, I can assure you it will   not be we Anticans who start it.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: But we will finish it.
scene: 38   INT. BADAR N'D'D'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Sir, warp power is fading!
Picard to Engineering. What is   our problem?
Warp five... four... three...   two...
We've lost the warp engine   computer tie!
And we just dropped below warp   one, sir.
Go to impulse power!
State of the art vessel? Hah.   Commander Data, signal Parliament   that we will be delayed. We will   send the new arrival time as soon   as determined.
Yes, sir.
Sir, subspace radio is out.
Your theories on the sudden   vulnerability of these systems,   gentlemen?
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: If the Enterprise were really this   fragile, sir, she never would have   gotten out of spacedock.   Therefore, her systems failures   are not endemic to the ship, but   are more likely the result of the   actions of an unknown adversary.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: We have a saboteur aboard.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: I believe I said that.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Gentlemen. The question now is,   who. I can't believe it's one   of our people.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Agreed. Which leaves someone in   either alien delegation. If the   Ferengi bribed or bought even one   of them, that's all that would   be needed.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Ferengi contacts have been   detected on both Selay and Antica,   sir.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Can any of you suggest another   solution?
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: You're sounding like a private   eye, sir.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Query: private eye?
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: A private consulting investigator   who solves crimes.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: A most interesting occupation.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: In the world of fact, it is, Data.   However in literature, criminal   detection becomes a fascinating   exercise.       The immortal Sherlock Holmes would   have an interesting view of our   mystery, I believe.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: I'm sure, sir -- but I'm afraid   we have to find our solution   without History's Greatest   Consulting Detective.
scene: 45   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, DATA

quote: Is it there, Mister Singh? If   the control network breaks at that   point...
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: ... it bleeds warp engine command   off into dead ends.       Excellent. I believe I can   handle it from there, Mister Crusher.
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: But, sir --
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: Your schedule shows classwork now.   Sorry.
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: Yes, sir.       But I don't learn nearly this much   in school.
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: I tend to agree. But the captain's   orders on this are very clear.
scene: 46   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH AND WESLEY

quote: Solve any new problems today?
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: I was starting to, maybe, but   Mister Singh sent me off to class.
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: Wes -- you're only an acting   ensign.       You have to let the commissioned   officers do some of the work.
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: Mom, listen. I've learned more   than they understand. For   example, on Channing's dilithium   crystals theory I was telling you   about...
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: When did you tell me about that?
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: This morning. Don't you remember?
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: Honestly, I don't, Wes.
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: You asked if the warp engines had   to do with navigation, and I said --
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: Why would I have said that?
scene: 47   INT. CRUSHERS' QUARTERS - ANGLE ON BEVERLY

quote: Mister Singh, the Captain wants --
scene: 48   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH (OPTICAL)

quote: Engineering to bridge. Security   alert!
scene: 48   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH (OPTICAL)

quote: Picard.
scene: 48   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH (OPTICAL)

quote: Lieutenant Worf, sir. I just found   Mister Singh.... he's dead.
scene: 48   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON SINGH (OPTICAL)

quote: Captain's log, stardate 41249.4.   Assistant Chief Engineer Singh   has been found dead in the Engine   Room Office, cause unknown. We   continue to run on impulse power.
I want the autopsy as soon as   possible, Doctor.
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: Captain, I'm so sorry. To have   one of our people die like this...
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: First, let's find out how he died.   Doctor?
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: The autopsy is underway, sir.
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: It could be... a word you're not   to use...       ...murder. Status of   investigation?
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: Underway.
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: Our best people.
scene: 50   INT. READY ROOM - PICARD, RIKER, CRUSHER, TASHA

quote: Sir, he may have been working   there on restoring warp power.
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: According to these readings, we   could go back to warp speed now.
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: But that wasn't the reading when   I left.
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: Singh probably repaired it just   before he was killed.
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: But he couldn't have fixed it from   here, sir! The problems we saw   were inside the engines!
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: Who else could have corrected it,   Wes?       Inform the bridge of engine   status.
scene: 51   INT. ENGINEER'S OFFICE - ANGLE ON WORF, WESLEY, GEORDI

quote: We now have warp capacity, sir.   All power on line.
scene: 52   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Well done. Warp engines ready.       On previous heading, warp factor   six.
scene: 52   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I tolerate these questions,   Lieutenant Yar, because I need   this vessel to get us to   Parliament. Your shipboard   problems do not concern me.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: They should. Our delays are your   delays.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: The peace conference will wait   for us.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: I must ask where you were during   this vessel's Earth hours of 1800   last night and 0700 this morning.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: Eating.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: Sir, I'm talking about hours   here...
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: It was a large meal.    (smiles, revealing sharp     canines)   And an interesting animal.
scene: 54   INT. GUEST QUARTERS - ANGLE ON TASHA, BADAR N'D'D

quote: You wanted me, Doctor?
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: Yes, concerning your memory   blackout.
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: I still don't remember having one.
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: The same thing happened to me.
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: I want to try hypnosis on both   of you. It may restore your   memory as to what happened.
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: I fear such things, but...
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: Fear from you, Worf?
scene: 55   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - TROI, BEVERLY, WORF

quote: One thing is clear... Almost all   the "peace" delegates answered   our questions with lies.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Imprecise, Lieutenant. They   omitted certain truths, which in   itself tells us something.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: We can learn something from   non-disclosure?
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Oh, indubitably, my good woman.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: It's something the Captain   mentioned. Sherlock Holmes, which   Data is obviously studying...
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Has studied, sir - every case.       As Holmes would have pointed   out... during the time in   question, something was afoot!
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: "Afoot?"
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: While both sets of delegates say   they were in their quarters, our   crew locator sensed them passing   here...       ... and here.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: But since they don't show where   they went, we're still in the   dark.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: On the contrary, dear colleague -   on their return they drew medical   supplies appropriate to the   treatment of minor wounds and   abrasions on these life forms.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Which, leaves you with only one   conclusion.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Exactly. That they were too   engaged in their own affairs to   have disabled our ship and   murdered the engineer. Given a   choice, they'd rather kill each   other than any of us. It's   elementary my dear Riker...sir.
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Speaking of aberrant behavior...
scene: 56   INT. RIKER'S QUARTERS - DATA, RIKER, TASHA (OPTICAL)

quote: Beverly... can you hear me?
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Yes.
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: I want you to go back in your mind   to the moment when you first   recall this sensation of memory   loss. Please picture it exactly   as it occurred.
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: He's lying on the hospital bed   sedated. I'm walking up to   him... I---       I -- I -- I --
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Gently...gently. How do you feel   at this moment -- as you lean over   him to take the specimen?
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: I... feel... someone else...   something else there too...
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: Go on.
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: I feel crowded. Not alone...   get out. Get out of my mind!
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: You said almost exactly the same   thing -- as though there were   something else inside you.
scene: 57   INT. SICKBAY - ANGLE ON TROI, BEVERLY AND WORF

quote: -- Which confirms the feeling of   duality that I sensed earlier in   both of them.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Why didn't you report it?
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Because, sir, I assumed at first   it was the kind of duality we   Betazoids feel in all of you.    (sees Picard's     expression harden)   Even you, sir. When you approach   a decision and ask yourself which   way to go... who are you talking   to?
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: (beat; his expression     still saying     "nonsense")   Your hypnotism revealed another   form of duality?
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Yes, sir. I believe something   invaded them.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: It seems the only possible   conclusion.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Data, let's proceed without the   pipe.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: If you wish, sir...       ... but I ask if you take it as   incontrovertible that it cannot   be a family member or one of our   crew?
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: (beat, considering;     then:)   Yes. Very unlikely.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Then our investigation was   worthwhile, sir. We have eliminated   both the delegates and all our   regular ship's complement.
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: What are you suggesting?
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: I am referring to the Great   Detective's credo, sir. I   quote... "We must fall back on   the old axiom that when other   contingencies fail, whatever   remains, however improbable, must   be the truth."
scene: 58   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - ANGLE ON PICARD, OFFICERS

quote: Wes, everything's fixed now.
That engine computer net wasn't   repaired, sir. It just suddenly   became all right.
It's the result that counts.       What --- ?
What is it?
Helm control just went down.       She won't respond.
Bridge to Captain. You're needed   here immediately.
Wes, alert Engineering from your   panel.
Trying...
Report.
Helm is down, sir. The ship's   running wild ---
Sir, we dropped to impulse   power --
Sir... ? Are you all right? I   thought I just saw ---
I'm fine.       Everything is fine now.
Why the drop to impulse power,   Lieutenant?
The helm is suddenly   malfunctioning, sir.
Malfunctioning? You're wrong --   Look again.
Sir, I ---
Mister La Forge?
There's nothing wrong with the   helm now. Everything is -- just   as it should be, sir.
In that case, make our heading   two-nine-five mark three-seven.
Sir... ?
You have a problem with that   heading, Lieutenant?
Do you want to double back on our   course, sir?
That is what I've ordered.
Captain... I'm puzzled about your   reversing our course.
The energy "cloud," Commander --   I believe it important to have   another look at it.
Sir, we're behind schedule to   Parliament already ---
I believe a very important   scientific discovery awaits us   on this heading.
Perhaps you'll share your   reasoning on that, sir?
Yes, since we obtained only   minimal information on our sensor   pass of it.
We must go back to learn more.       Counselor... do you believe a ship   captain should explain every   order?
Of course not, sir.
I demand to see the captain.
Stop, return to your quarters... !
What is that doing on our deck?
I demand to know why this starship   has changed course!
Please return to your quarters,   delegates!
You're late and you asked for this   confidential meeting.
Sorry. I was just so troubled   by my talk with the captain.   Something seems wrong... terribly   wrong.
I believe I sense something   ... different in the Captain ... not   much and maybe I'm incorrect.    (indicates Riker, Data     and Geordi)   They think I may be.
You could be reacting to the   reverse course order.
But that's our captain. It's not   the first time he's done something   unusual.
A mere change of direction hardly   justifies mutiny.
Exactly what do you believe you're   sensing?
Exactly?       It's difficult to put into   words... just a feeling that   he's, well... closed part of his   mind to me.
How can you tell there's something   there that you can't feel?
As I said... it's hard to say.   I just feel the captain's become   ... perhaps dangerous.
If he's dangerous...if...
... he'd have to be relieved from   command.       Which you're allowed to do... but   it's beaucoup trouble if you're   wrong.
And at this moment it is all pure   speculation. He has done nothing   to subject the Enterprise to   danger.
Besides, I'd need a medical log   giving clear evidence of   incapacity.       You could do it without that   problem...
Only if all command officers   agreed it vital to do so. But   he's not showing overt unusual   behavior.
Ultimately he will, I believe...
Commander, as second in command,   it's still in your corner. I'll   order medical and psychiatric   exams... You'll have to back me   up somehow.
First Officer's log, stardate   41249.5. As I believed, the   senior command officers refused   to relieve the captain from duty   on such slender evidence.
Yes?
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I'd like you to come to Sickbay   for some examinations, Captain.
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Oh?       I'll be glad to do that when I'm   free.
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I'd like to conduct them now, sir.
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Why?       What can I do for you, Number One?
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Sir, Counselor Troi has   recommended the examinations.
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Same question. Why?
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: It is my duty to inform the   captain that we believe it   possible that he is under some   kind of alien influence   which... may constitute a danger   to this ship.
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I consider it equally possible   that you two and the counselor   are overworked, and possibly   suffering hallucinations.       This is an order... you're to   arrange medical and psychiatric   exams of both yourself and them.   Doctor, you realize you're all   acting strangely?
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I'm concerned that you've suddenly   turned the ship away from...
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: What's happened to your mind,   Doctor? The search for knowledge   is always our primary mission.       I'm sorry but I'm too busy for   this kind of nonsense. Must I   call security to force you to   report to Sickbay?
scene: 82   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: What in hell... ?
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Sorry. Wrong species.
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Riker to security chief.
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Yar here.
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Security squad to the Engineering   Deck. The Selays are playing hide   and seek down here -- obviously   with the Anticans --       -- and it's a lethal game. I want   them returned to their quarters   under guard.
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Right away, sir.       And are you... aware sir, the   captain expects you to take a   medical exam?
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: I'll do it later.
scene: 85   INT. CORRIDOR NEAR ENGINEERING - ANGLE ON TURBOLIFT

quote: Come.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: What do you want?
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I have the results of the exams   you ordered.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: You don't care to inspect them?
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Please, are you Jean-Luc?
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: He is here.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: The Jean-Luc I know?
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: And more.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: The "more" frightens me...
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: And elates us. We wish you could   understand the glorious adventures   ahead.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: You and... ?
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Soon we'll both be home.
scene: 88   INT. READY ROOM - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: First officer's log, supplemental.   On the orders of... Captain   Picard, we have returned to the   vicinity of the energy pattern   "cloud." I am personally   convinced that something from this   "cloud" now shares...

... the captain's mind. But there   seems to be nothing we can do...   at least within regulations.   There have been no actions   warranting relieving Captain   Picard. And our medical   personnel, while dubious about   his condition, are not prepared   to certify the captain's   incapacity.
Approaching the "cloud," sir.
Very well, Mister La Forge. Bring   us to within ten thousand   kilometers and hold us there.
Aye, sir.
Shall we begin the scientific   tests that you wanted, sir?
They are already underway.
I have an announcement for the   entire bridge.

As many of you suspected...    (indicating "cloud"     image)   ... when our ship passed through   the edge of this, it accidentally   carried off a sentient being... one   much like these energy patterns   we're seeing here.

A frightening experience for any   intelligent being. As if a great   claw reached down and scooped up   any of you from your home world.   Drawn into the energy pathways   of this vessel...       ... it found its way to you, Worf,   frantic at being carried from its   home. Recognizing you as   sentient beings, it pleaded for   help.

... but in ways you could not   understand... going desperately   from one to another of you...   then discovering the computer   intelligence in the ship's memory   circuits.       Simplistic intelligence, but it   furnished a way to slow this   Enterprise thing that had captured   it.       And it very much regrets the   accidental death of Engineer Singh   during this...
Captain, do you exist in   combination with the entity?
Is it in control of you, sir?
By the time we combined...

... We had learned much about each   other... our passion for   exploration... for the unknown.   We found we had similar   dreams... and it offered your   captain a way to realize them   beyond any human expectation.
Captain, I must speak to you   privately...now.
I understand. As an energy   pattern free of the limitations   of matter... it might travel   anywhere, at any velocity...
Captain, did you hear me?
Sir, I see no way for you to   journey with an energy form.
Isn't there?
Maybe... just maybe...       He's planning to beam both the   entity and himself into that   "cloud."
The transporter need not pattern   your captain back into matter...   we'll beam energy only...
... and we will become...       ... a combined energy pattern of   that life form.
A resignation from this command   and from Starfleet has been   appropriately recorded...
I refuse to allow this, sir.
Oh? Under what Fleet regulation?   Does this resignation threaten   the ship and its company in any   way?
Captain Picard, you are now   relieved from duty. I judge you   disabled...
... mentally incapacitated...
Security! Help me restrain the   Captain...
This is blinding me...
... Where is he? These light   flashes...
Captain! I'll help you if you'll   let me...
Hang on to the captain, someone!
The Transporter Chief has no idea   of what the coordinates were, sir.
He's just out there "somewhere?"   How can we settle for that?
Give me a choice, then.
Still no readings, no sign of   anything.
Mister La Forge, it's time to   set a course for Parliament. Warp   eight.
We're really leaving him... ?
I've waited as long as possible,   Lieutenant.
Wait! I'm feeling... yes, it's   the captain!       The captain only. He's out there   alone!
The entity... has it abandoned him?
Aban... ? No, the combination just   wasn't possible out there.       The Captain's in trouble, sir;   we must beam him back!
Beam him back as what? He's   nothing but energy now.
Sir, the entity was caught by   the ship's circuitry -- the   captain might try to get in the   same way if he's in trouble!
Move the ship in closer!
Moving in, sir. But where?
No way to know. Let's hope he   can come part way himself.
Troi, is there any way you can...   "get" a message to him?
I wish I could.
Sensors are monitoring our   perimeter, the ship's circuitry...       Nothing, sir.
Take us into the edge of it, La   Forge.
Mom, is he gone for good?
The funny thing is, I... I sort   of liked him...
Sir! On my sensor controls...
Something's here. I can feel it!
Just as before! Going to you   first, Worf...
Something crazy on my viewer   circuits...       Commander Riker!
"Static?"
"P" for Picard!
He's in the ship's circuitry!   Come to the Transporter Room.   Please!
There might be a way, sir! Hurry!
This is a wild theory Data!
I knew we had to have the   captain's physical pattern here,   He was the last one beamed out.
Is what you're thinking possible?
Unknown at this time, sir. I   hope the captain remembers his   pattern is here.       If he has, his energy has moved   into the transporter relays by   now...
Wish we had some sign he's there.       We've no choice but to risk it.
Energizing, sir!
What the devil am I doing here?!
Sounds like our Captain...
But confused. This Picard-pattern   was formed before he went out   there...
What's happening to me, Number   One? I was ready to beam away...   somewhere... I remember talk of   an... an entity? But all that   seems so vague...
I believe the Captain is now his   separate self, sir. A lot of what   happened is naturally missing...
Data, what nonsense are you   talking now? Is it still   "Sherlock Holmes?"
Ah, yes. Indubitably, sir,   indubitably.
Well, at least get rid of that   damned pipe. It smells.
Doctor Crusher asked me to steer   you past Sickbay. She says you've   looked very tired.
Sorry Commander, but Security Team   Two reports they've discovered   a puddle of blood outside the   Selay Quarters and they can't   find one of the delegates and...
Lieutenant, couldn't this have   waited a moment? We've got the   captain back.
Good to see you, sir. The problem   is that one of the cooks has just   been asked to broil Reptile for   the Anticans... and it looks like   the Selay delegate...
Riker, with these "peace"   delegates and all, I do need some   rest. Take charge, Number One.
